result.markdown:
1. How many different types of CSD (`csd_type`) are there in the dataset?



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true" code-summary="Show the solution"}
towny %>%
  count(csd_type)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 5 × 2
  csd_type         n
  <chr>        <int>
1 city            52
2 municipality    68
3 town            88
4 township       195
5 village         11
```


:::
:::



2. How many different types of CSD and status (`status`) are there in the dataset?



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true" code-summary="Show the solution"}
towny %>%
  count(csd_type, status)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 10 × 3
   csd_type     status          n
   <chr>        <chr>       <int>
 1 city         lower-tier     20
 2 city         single-tier    32
 3 municipality lower-tier     41
 4 municipality single-tier    27
 5 town         lower-tier     61
 6 town         single-tier    27
 7 township     lower-tier    113
 8 township     single-tier    82
 9 village      lower-tier      6
10 village      single-tier     5
```


:::
:::



3. What is the proportion of each type of CSD?



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true" code-summary="Show the solution"}
towny %>%
  count(csd_type) %>%
  mutate(p = n / sum(n))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 5 × 3
  csd_type         n      p
  <chr>        <int>  <dbl>
1 city            52 0.126 
2 municipality    68 0.164 
3 town            88 0.213 
4 township       195 0.471 
5 village         11 0.0266
```


:::
:::



4. What is the proportion of each status within type of CSD?



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true" code-summary="Show the solution"}
towny %>%
  count(csd_type, status) %>%
  group_by(csd_type) %>%
  mutate(p = n / sum(n))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 10 × 4
# Groups:   csd_type [5]
   csd_type     status          n     p
   <chr>        <chr>       <int> <dbl>
 1 city         lower-tier     20 0.385
 2 city         single-tier    32 0.615
 3 municipality lower-tier     41 0.603
 4 municipality single-tier    27 0.397
 5 town         lower-tier     61 0.693
 6 town         single-tier    27 0.307
 7 township     lower-tier    113 0.579
 8 township     single-tier    82 0.421
 9 village      lower-tier      6 0.545
10 village      single-tier     5 0.455
```


:::
:::



5. What is the mean population of all of the municipalities in 2021?



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true" code-summary="Show the solution"}
towny %>%
  summarize(mean_pop = mean(population_2021, na.rm = TRUE))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 1 × 1
  mean_pop
     <dbl>
1   34142.
```


:::
:::



6. What is the mean population by CSD Type in 2021?



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true" code-summary="Show the solution"}
towny %>%
  group_by(csd_type) %>%
  summarize(mean_pop = mean(population_2021, na.rm = TRUE))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 5 × 2
  csd_type     mean_pop
  <chr>           <dbl>
1 city          200005.
2 municipality   10102.
3 town           22579.
4 township        5367.
5 village         1276.
```


:::
:::



7. What is the mean population of all of the municipalities in 1996, 2001, 2006, 2011, 2016, and 2021? Try to use the across function.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true" code-summary="Show the solution"}
towny %>%
  summarize(across(starts_with("population"), ~mean(.x, na.rm = TRUE)))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 1 × 6
  population_1996 population_2001 population_2006 population_2011
            <dbl>           <dbl>           <dbl>           <dbl>
1          25866.          27538.          29173.          30838.
# ℹ 2 more variables: population_2016 <dbl>, population_2021 <dbl>
```


:::
:::



8. Run a simple t-test to see if the average population in 1996 is different from the average population in 2016.



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true" code-summary="Show the solution"}
t.test(towny$population_1996, towny$population_2016, paired = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

	Paired t-test

data:  towny$population_1996 and towny$population_2016
t = -4.3204, df = 410, p-value = 1.956e-05
alternative hypothesis: true mean difference is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 -9593.244 -3593.423
sample estimates:
mean difference 
      -6593.333 
```


:::
:::



or



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="true" code-summary="Show another solution"}
t.test(population_1996-population_2016~1, data=towny)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

	One Sample t-test

data:  population_1996 - population_2016
t = -4.3204, df = 410, p-value = 1.956e-05
alternative hypothesis: true mean is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 -9593.244 -3593.423
sample estimates:
mean of x 
-6593.333 
```


:::
:::
